bcbioSingleCell 0.1.0
  • Reference

Plot Top Markers

Source: R/AllGenerics.R, R/methods-plotTopMarkers.R

Plot Top Markers

plotTopMarkers(object, topMarkers, ...)

# S4 method for seurat,grouped_df
plotTopMarkers(object, topMarkers,
  tsneColor = scale_color_viridis(discrete = FALSE),
  violinFill = scale_fill_viridis(discrete = TRUE),
  dotColor = scale_color_gradient(low = "lightgray", high = "purple"),
  dark = TRUE, pointsAsNumbers = FALSE, headerLevel = 2L)

Arguments

object

Object.
topMarkers

grouped_df grouped by "cluster", returned by topMarkers().
...

Additional arguments.
tsneColor

Color palette to use for tSNE plot.
violinFill

Color palette to use for violin plot.
dotColor

Color palette to use for dot plot.
dark

Plot against a dark background using basejump::midnightTheme().
pointsAsNumbers

Plot the points as numbers (TRUE) or dots (FALSE).
headerLevel

R Markdown header level.

Value

Show graphical output. Invisibly return ggplot list.

Note

The number of markers to plot is determined by the output of the topMarkers() function. If you want to reduce the number of genes to plot, simply reassign first using that function. If necessary, we can add support for the number of genes to plot here in a future update.

See also

Other Clustering Functions: cellTypesPerCluster, knownMarkersDetected, plotCellTypesPerCluster, plotFeatureTSNE, plotKnownMarkersDetected, plotMarkerTSNE, plotMarkers, plotPCA, plotPCElbow, plotTSNE, sanitizeMarkers, topMarkers

Examples

# seurat, grouped_df ====
plotTopMarkers(
    object = seurat_small,
    topMarkers = topMarkers(all_markers_small, n = 1L)
)
#> 
   |                                                  | 0 % ~calculating
